title: Joe Mazzulla explained his decision to challenge the Boston media to a pickup game
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "We all got to be on the same playing field .
The only thing that would have made it better is if we all went out for a beer afterwards.

title: A 5-story building near South Station is headed to auction
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Real Estate The sale comes as downtown Boston’s office and retail markets struggle to recover their pre-pandemic value.

title: This Mass. farm is the perfect fall day-trip

title: How much do you make in Boston? We want to hear from you.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Tell us your salary, job field, and what it’s like balancing work and life in Boston.
We’re looking to better understand the people behind Greater Boston’s workforce.

(Adobe Stock/Globe Staff Illustration) By Annie Jonas October 15, 2025 | 1:36 PM 1 minute to read Boston consistently ranks among the most expensive cities in the country – and it’s only getting harder to make ends meet.

title: Kiss 108 morning hosts address ‘shock’ layoff of Winnie Akoury
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Media Akoury, a producer and cohost of "Billy & Lisa in the Morning," was one of numerous media personalities affected by nationwide layoffs at iHeartMedia.
Winnie Akoury (far left), Billy Costa, Lisa Donovan, and Justin Aguirre of Kiss 108's "Billy & Lisa in the Morning.
" Jordan Corey / iHeartMedia ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Facing federal pressure, Fenway Health halts gender-affirming care for patients under 19
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The Boston clinic's move has prompted backlash from community members.
Outside of Fenway Health at 1340 Boylston St.

(Pat Greenhouse/ The Boston Globe Staff) Fenway Health, a cornerstone of Boston’s LGBTQ+ community, announced Monday that it will stop providing gender-affirming care for patients under 19 — a decision the clinic says comes in response to new federal requirements tied to its funding.

title: Retired MSP sergeant gets jail time for commercial driver’s license scheme
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime “Put simply, [Gary] Cederquist is the very embodiment of public corruption,” prosecutors said.
Gary Cederquist leaves federal court in Boston in 2024.
